au_20330: How to run a script without closing the terminal?
ul_207812: How to stop a background process started in the same script, without exit the script?
Top-3 Scripts:
so_24843614: $ function x { for A in {1..100}; do echo "$A"; sleep 1s; done }
$ read pid < <(x & echo $!)
$ kill -s 0 "$pid" &>/dev/null && echo "Process active." || echo "Process died."
Process died.
$ read pid < <(x > /dev/null & echo $!)
$ kill -s 0 "$pid" &>/dev/null && echo "Process active." || echo "Process died."
Process active.

Explanations about Options.-s:
Specify the signal to be sent. The signal can be specified by using name or
 number. The behavior of signals is explained in signal(7) manual page.

Explanations about Options.-geometry:
This option specifies the preferred size and position of the VTxxx window; see
 X(7).
Explanations about Options.-n:
This option specifies the icon name for xterm's windows. It is shorthand for
 specifying the “iconName” resource. Note that this is not the same as the toolkit
 option -name. The default icon name is the application name.
